results.title: Metformin combined with rapamycin ameliorates podocyte injury in idiopathic membranous nephropathy through the AMPK/mTOR signaling pathway
results.text_hl: However, the therapeutic mechanisms of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Sirolimus @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020123 @@@rapamycin@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@IMN@@@ remain unclear.

results.title: Metformin Suppresses Development of the Echinococcus multilocularis Larval Stage by Targeting the TOR Pathway.
results.text_hl: Our results revealed @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@mitochondrial membrane@@@ depolarization, activation of Em-AMPK, suppression of Em-TOR, and overexpression of Em-@GENE_MAP1LC3B @GENE_67443 @@@Atg8@@@ in the germinal layer of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-treated metacestode vesicles.

citations.NLM: Loos JA, Dávila VA, Brehm K, Cumino AC. Metformin Suppresses Development of the Echinococcus multilocularis Larval Stage by Targeting the TOR Pathway. Antimicrob Agents Chemother. 2020 Aug 20;64(9):. PMID: 32540980

results.title: Targeting autophagy in autoimmune glomerular diseases.
results.text_hl: Drugs that improve mitochondrial function or enhance autophagy, such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @GENE_SLC5A2 @GENE_6524 @@@sodium-glucose co-transporter 2@@@ (@GENE_SLC5A2 @GENE_6524 @@@SGLT2@@@) inhibitors or @GENE_MTOR @GENE_2475 @@@mTOR@@@ inhibitors, may exert protective effects on podocytes and reduce @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@MN@@@ or @DISEASE_Glomerulosclerosis_Focal_Segmental @DISEASE_MESH:D005923 @@@focal segmental glomerulosclerosis@@@ (@DISEASE_Glomerulosclerosis_Focal_Segmental @DISEASE_MESH:D005923 @@@FSGS@@@).

citations.NLM: Claudio P, Gabriella M. Targeting autophagy in autoimmune glomerular diseases. J Nephrol. 2025 Mar 19;():. PMID: 40106213
citations.BibTeX: @article{40106213, title={Targeting autophagy in autoimmune glomerular diseases.}, author={Claudio P and Gabriella M}, journal={J Nephrol}}

results.title: In vitro and in vivo anti-melanoma action of metformin.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@-mediated apoptosis of @DISEASE_Melanoma @DISEASE_MESH:D008545 @@@melanoma@@@ cells was preceded by induction of oxidative stress and mitochondrial @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@membrane@@@ depolarization, measured by flow cytometry in cells stained with appropriate fluorescent reporter dyes.

citations.NLM: Janjetovic K, Harhaji-Trajkovic L, Misirkic-Marjanovic M, Vucicevic L, Stevanovic D, Zogovic N, Sumarac-Dumanovic M, Micic D, Trajkovic V. In vitro and in vivo anti-melanoma action of metformin. Eur J Pharmacol. 2011 Oct 15;668(3):373-82. PMID: 21806981

results.title: Metformin Protects Cells from Mutant Huntingtin Toxicity Through Activation of AMPK and Modulation of Mitochondrial Dynamics.
results.text_hl: Furthermore, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment prevented @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@mitochondrial membrane depolarization@@@ and excess fission and modulated the disturbed mitochondrial dynamics in @DISEASE_Huntington_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D006816 @@@HD@@@ cells.

results.title: Synchronized Ratiometric Codelivery of Metformin and Topotecan through Engineered Nanocarrier Facilitates In Vivo Synergistic Precision Levels at Tumor Site.
results.text_hl: Coloaded @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Topotecan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019772 @@@TPT@@@ LB-MSNs present synergistic @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@cytotoxicity@@@ against @CELLLINE_CVCL:YA89 @@@MDA-MB-231/4T1@@@ cells and effectively promote apoptosis via @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@mitochondrial membrane@@@ depolarization and cell cycle arrest.
